1using System;
2using System.Collections.Generic;
3​
4namespace TechnicalIndicators
5{
6 /// <summary>
7 /// Up Down Volume Ratio
8 /// </summary>
9 /// <remarks>
10 /// A volume-based indicator to gauge buyer/seller strength.
11 /// <list type="bullet">
12 /// <item><description>Separates volume into "Up Volume" (Price rose) and "Down Volume" (Price fell).</description></item>
13 /// <item><description>Ratio = Sum(UpVolume) / Sum(DownVolume).</description></item>
14 /// <item><description>Values > 1 indicate bullish pressure; Values < 1 indicate bearish pressure.</description></item>
15 /// </list>
16 /// </remarks>
17 public class UpDownVolumeRatioIndicator
18 {
19 public int Period { get; }
20 public List<decimal?> Values { get; } = new();
21​
22 public UpDownVolumeRatioIndicator(int period = 14)
23 {
24 if (period <= 0) throw new ArgumentOutOfRangeException(nameof(period));
25 Period = period;
26 }
27​
28 public void Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles)
29 {
30 Values.Clear();
31 var c = new List<CandleData>(candles);
32 if (c.Count == 0) return;
33​
34 var upVolume = new List<long>();
35 var downVolume = new List<long>();
36​
37 for (int i = 0; i < c.Count; i++)
38 {
39 if (i == 0)
40 {
41 upVolume.Add(0);
42 downVolume.Add(0);
43 }
44 else
45 {
46 if (c[i].Close > c[i - 1].Close)
47 {
48 upVolume.Add(c[i].Volume);
49 downVolume.Add(0);
50 }
51 else if (c[i].Close < c[i - 1].Close)
52 {
53 upVolume.Add(0);
54 downVolume.Add(c[i].Volume);
55 }
56 else
57 {
58 upVolume.Add(0);
59 downVolume.Add(0);
60 }
61 }
62 }
63​
64 for (int i = 0; i < c.Count; i++)
65 {
66 if (i < Period - 1) { Values.Add(null); continue; }
67​
68 long sumUp = 0, sumDown = 0;
69 for (int j = 0; j < Period; j++)
70 {
71 sumUp += upVolume[i - j];
72 sumDown += downVolume[i - j];
73 }
74​
75 if (sumDown == 0)
76 Values.Add(sumUp == 0 ? 1m : 100m); // C# implementation used 1 or 100 for safety
77
78 else
79 Values.Add((decimal)sumUp / sumDown);
80 }
81 }
82​
83 public static List<decimal?> Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles, int period = 14)
84 {
85 var indicator = new UpDownVolumeRatioIndicator(period);
86 indicator.Calculate(candles);
87 return indicator.Values;
88 }
89 }
90}

1// =============================================================================
2// Logic Breakdown (Up/Down Volume Ratio Indicator)
3// =============================================================================
4//
5// [Core Concepts]
6// 1. Volume Classification: Assign volume to Up or Down based on price change
7// 2. Rolling Ratio: Sum(UpVolume) / Sum(DownVolume) over period
8// 3. Sentiment Gauge: Ratio > 1 = bullish, Ratio < 1 = bearish
9//
10// [Visual] Volume Classification:
11// Close > PrevClose → UpVolume += Volume, DownVolume += 0
12// Close < PrevClose → UpVolume += 0, DownVolume += Volume
13// Close = PrevClose → Both += 0 (neutral)
14//
15// =============================================================================
16​
17using System;
18using System.Collections.Generic;
19​
20namespace TechnicalIndicators
21{
22 // =========================================================================
23 // Logic Explanation: OHLCV Data Container (CandleData)
24 // =========================================================================
25 public readonly record struct CandleData(
26 DateTime Timestamp, decimal Open, decimal High, decimal Low, decimal Close, long Volume
27 );
28​
29 // =========================================================================
30 // Logic Explanation: Up/Down Volume Ratio Calculator
31 //
32 // [Why] Volume confirms price movement. High up-volume on rallies
33 // and low down-volume on declines indicates strong momentum.
34 // [What] Outputs ratio values (>1 bullish, <1 bearish).
35 // =========================================================================
36 public class UpDownVolumeRatioIndicator
37 {
38 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
39 // Variable Definition: Period
40 // [Role] Rolling window for volume summation.
41 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
42 public int Period { get; }
43​
44 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
45 // Variable Definition: Output Values
46 // [Role] Stores ratio values. Range: 0 to infinity (typically 0.5-2).
47 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
48 public List<decimal?> Values { get; } = new();
49​
50 // =====================================================================
51 // Logic Explanation: Constructor
52 // [Why] Validates Period > 0 (Fail Fast).
53 // =====================================================================
54 public UpDownVolumeRatioIndicator(int period = 14)
55 {
56 if (period <= 0) throw new ArgumentOutOfRangeException(nameof(period));
57 Period = period;
58 }
59​
60 // =====================================================================
61 // IPO: Calculate
62 // [Input] candles - OHLCV data
63 // [Process] Classify volume → Rolling sum → Ratio
64 // [Output] Populates Values list
65 // =====================================================================
66 public void Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles)
67 {
68 Values.Clear();
69 var c = new List<CandleData>(candles);
70 if (c.Count == 0) return;
71​
72 // -----------------------------------------------------------------
73 // Logic Step 1: Classify Volume as Up or Down
74 //
75 // [Why] Separate volume by directional context.
76 // [How] Compare current Close to previous Close.
77 //
78 // [Visual] Classification Rules:
79 // Day 1: Close 100 → 102 (Up) → UpVol = 1000, DownVol = 0
80 // Day 2: Close 102 → 101 (Down) → UpVol = 0, DownVol = 800
81 // Day 3: Close 101 → 101 (Flat) → UpVol = 0, DownVol = 0
82 // -----------------------------------------------------------------
83 var upVolume = new List<long>();
84 var downVolume = new List<long>();
85​
86 for (int i = 0; i < c.Count; i++)
87 {
88 if (i == 0)
89 {
90 // First bar: no comparison possible
91 upVolume.Add(0);
92 downVolume.Add(0);
93 }
94 else
95 {
96 if (c[i].Close > c[i - 1].Close)
97 {
98 upVolume.Add(c[i].Volume);
99 downVolume.Add(0);
100 }
101 else if (c[i].Close < c[i - 1].Close)
102 {
103 upVolume.Add(0);
104 downVolume.Add(c[i].Volume);
105 }
106 else
107 {
108 // Unchanged close: neutral
109 upVolume.Add(0);
110 downVolume.Add(0);
111 }
112 }
113 }
114​
115 // -----------------------------------------------------------------
116 // Logic Step 2: Calculate Rolling Ratio
117 //
118 // [Why] Smooth the ratio over period for stability.
119 // [How] Ratio = Sum(UpVolume) / Sum(DownVolume)
120 //
121 // [Visual] Edge Cases:
122 // DownVol = 0, UpVol > 0 → Ratio = 100 (extremely bullish)
123 // Both = 0 → Ratio = 1 (neutral)
124 // -----------------------------------------------------------------
125 for (int i = 0; i < c.Count; i++)
126 {
127 if (i < Period - 1) { Values.Add(null); continue; }
128​
129 long sumUp = 0, sumDown = 0;
130 for (int j = 0; j < Period; j++)
131 {
132 sumUp += upVolume[i - j];
133 sumDown += downVolume[i - j];
134 }
135​
136 // Handle edge cases
137 if (sumDown == 0)
138 Values.Add(sumUp == 0 ? 1m : 100m);
139 else
140 Values.Add((decimal)sumUp / sumDown);
141 }
142 }
143​
144 // =====================================================================
145 // IPO: Calculate (Static Factory)
146 // =====================================================================
147 public static List<decimal?> Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles, int period = 14)
148 {
149 var indicator = new UpDownVolumeRatioIndicator(period);
150 indicator.Calculate(candles);
151 return indicator.Values;
152 }
153 }
154}

1# =============================================================================
2# Logic Breakdown (Up/Down Volume Ratio)
3# =============================================================================
4#
5# This document provides a "Deep Dive" into the internal logic of the
6# Up/Down Volume Ratio.
7#
8# [Core Concepts]
9# 1. Volume Classification
10# - To analyze volume flow, we must first classify each day's volume.
11# - Up Volume: Volume on days when Close > PrevClose.
12# - Down Volume: Volume on days when Close < PrevClose.
13# - Neutral Volume: Volume on days when Close == PrevClose (usually ignored).
14#
15# 2. The Ratio (Sentiment Gauge)
16# - Ratio = Sum(UpVolume) / Sum(DownVolume).
17# - If > 1.0: Bulls are controlling the volume (Accumulation).
18# - If < 1.0: Bears are controlling the volume (Distribution).
19# - Extreme Highs (e.g., > 10): Possible Climax/Exhaustion.
20#
21# [Formula]
22# Ratio = Sum(UpVolume, N) / Sum(DownVolume, N)
23#
24# =============================================================================
25​
26# -------------------------------------------------------------
27# Type-Level Explanation: UpDownVolumeRatioIndicator (class)
28#
29# [Why] Quantifies buying pressure vs selling pressure via volume.
30# [What] Supply/Demand oscillator.
31# [How] Classifies daily volume as 'Up' or 'Down' based on price change, sums them over a period, and calculates the ratio.
32# -------------------------------------------------------------
33class UpDownVolumeRatioIndicator:
34
35 # -------------------------------------------------------------
36 # Constructor: __init__
37 # [Why] Period determines the smoothing/sensitivity window (Standard 14).
38 # -------------------------------------------------------------
39 def __init__(self, period=14):
40 if period <= 0:
41 raise ValueError("period must be > 0")
42 self.period = period
43 self.values = []
44​
45 # =============================================================================
46 # IPO: calculate
47 # =============================================================================
48 #
49 # [Input]
50 # - candles: List[dict]
51 #
52 # [Process]
53 # 1. Iterate through candles.
54 # 2. Classify daily volume into 'Up' or 'Down' buckets based on price change.
55 # 3. Sum these buckets over 'period'.
56 # 4. Compute Ratio (UpSum / DownSum).
57 #
58 # [Output]
59 # - None.
60 # =============================================================================
61 def calculate(self, candles):
62
63 # -------------------------------------------------------------
64 # Logic Step 1: Reset
65 # [Why] Clear previous data to ensure a fresh calculation state.
66 # [How] Reset the values list and validate input size.
67 # -------------------------------------------------------------
68 self.values.clear()
69 if len(candles) == 0:
70 return
71​
72 # -------------------------------------------------------------
73 # Logic Step 2: Classify Volume (Pre-Process)
74 # [Why] Separate the raw volume stream into two components for easier summation.
75 # [How] Iterate through candles. If Close > PrevClose, assign Volume to UpStream. If Close < PrevClose, assign to DownStream.
76 # -------------------------------------------------------------
77 up_vol_stream = []
78 down_vol_stream = []
79
80 for i in range(len(candles)):
81 current_close = candles[i]['close']
82 current_vol = candles[i]['volume']
83
84 # Boundary check for first candle
85 prev_close = candles[i-1]['close'] if i > 0 else current_close
86
87 # Classification Logic
88 if current_close > prev_close:
89 up_vol_stream.append(current_vol)
90 down_vol_stream.append(0)
91 elif current_close < prev_close:
92 up_vol_stream.append(0)
93 down_vol_stream.append(current_vol)
94 else:
95 # Neutral (Doji)
96 up_vol_stream.append(0)
97 down_vol_stream.append(0)
98​
99 # -------------------------------------------------------------
100 # Logic Step 3: Compute Ratio
101 # [Why] Measures the relative strength of bullish vs bearish volume over the specific window.
102 # [How] Sum UpVolume and DownVolume for the period, then divide UpSum by DownSum.
103 # -------------------------------------------------------------
104 for i in range(len(candles)):
105
106 # Wait for Period
107 if i < self.period - 1:
108 self.values.append(None)
109 continue
110
111 # [Visual]
112 # Window: [Up1, Up2, ... UpN] vs [Down1, Down2, ... DownN]
113 # Sum them separately.
114
115 # Note: Using simple slicing sum (O(N) per step).
116 # Can be optimized to O(1) with running sums, but standard for clarity.
117 start_idx = i - self.period + 1
118 end_idx = i + 1
119
120 sum_up = sum(up_vol_stream[start_idx : end_idx])
121 sum_down = sum(down_vol_stream[start_idx : end_idx])
122
123 # Handle Division by Zero (No Down Volume)
124 if sum_down == 0:
125 if sum_up == 0:
126 self.values.append(1.0) # Nothing happened
127 else:
128 self.values.append(100.0) # Arbitrary Max Cap (Limit Infinity)
129 else:
130 ratio = sum_up / sum_down
131 self.values.append(ratio)
132​
133​
134# =============================================================================
135# Static Wrapper Function
136# =============================================================================
137def calculate(candles, period=14):
138 indicator = UpDownVolumeRatioIndicator(period)
139 indicator.calculate(candles)
140 return indicator.values
